creator: jawarren@trentu.ca
text:
Apache was compiled a layout such that:
sysconfdir: /etc/apache

Yet when `apachectl start` is run, it dies with:
httpd: could not open document config file /usr/local/apache2/conf/httpd.conf

It may be related that httpd is also not creating a PID file in the appropriate
location.
creator: jawarren@trentu.ca
jawarren@trentu.ca
text: apxs is also not obeying installbuilddir

creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
Currently, httpd-2.0 is not as tolerant of layouts that have lots of disjoint
directories (such as /etc/apache for sysconfdir).

This is a matter that we are addressing and hope to resolve in forthcoming releases.

Some of the issues that you raise are already fixed in CVS (spec. the PID
problem - see bug 7841).

Thanks for using Apache!

A fix for this was just committed: 
  +  *) Fix generation of default httpd.conf when the layout paths are 
  +     disjoint.  PR 8227.  [Justin Erenkrantz] 
  + 
 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8227 ***
creator: jwoolley@apache.org
